articles.title: Supreme Public Prosecutors Office Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
Supreme Public Prosecutors Office Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme Public Prosecutors Office headed by Director Jang Pyong Gyu came back home on Tuesday after visiting Vietnam.

articles.title: DPRK Maritime Administration Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Maritime Administration Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Maritime Administration of the DPRK headed by Director Jon Ki Chol came back home on Tuesday after taking part in the 29th session of the Assembly of the International Maritime Organization (IMO) held in London.

articles.title: State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band to Pay Friendship Visit to China
articles.content:
State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band to Pay Friendship Visit to China
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band will pay friendship visit to China to give performances from December 10 to 15.
					 The visit by the State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band will contribute to deepening friendship and boosting the cultural and artistic exchanges between the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Workers across Country Respond to Appeal of Workers of Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
Workers across Country Respond to Appeal of Workers of Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Employees' meetings took place at industrial establishments across the country in hearty response to the appeal made by the workers of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex to greet the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The above-said appeal was read out and reports and speeches were made there.
					
					 A reporter and speakers at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex said at the meeting that the workers in the field of the metal industry would cherish the noble sense of duty that they are pioneers in building a thriving nation, put it on a modern and IT basis, regarding science and technology as their life and soul, and intensify their drive for locally producing necessary raw and other materials and equipment.
					
					 Workers of the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex and the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex also held meetings to vow to make an active contribution to the improvement of the people's standard of living by firmly establishing the independent production system relying on the locally available materials and resources and fully providing materials and fertilizers necessary for the fields of the light industry and agriculture.
					
					 The employees of the Ranam Coal-mining Machine Complex held a meeting to renew their pledge to respond to the appeal of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex with signal successes in production.
					
					 The workers of the Jongbangsan Combined Foodstuff Factory vowed to boost the production of tasty and highly nutritious food by their own efforts and with indigenous technology, noting that it is an ambition and goal of the Korean workers to make the best things which may excel the world standard.

articles.title: Successes Made in Field of Literature, Art in 2015
articles.content:
Successes Made in Field of Literature, Art in 2015
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- This year the field of art and literature in the DPRK produced lots of masterpieces that reflected the thoughts and feelings of the people and the spirit of the times and staged art performances encouraging the service personnel and people in the drive for bringing about a great surge.
					 The April 15 Literary Production Centre published a full-length novel "Dignity" of the cycle of novels "Immortal History" and a full-length novel "May the Morning Shine" of the cycle of novels "Immortal Guidance". They deal with the revolutionary feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The year saw creation of lots of literary works of cycle of novels on the revolutionary legends and 10 full-length novels. 
					
					 Famous revolutionary songs were composed.
					
					 "Our Dear Marshal", "His Humanity" and "Yearning Is My Happiness" and other songs represented all the service personnel and people's attraction and reverence for Marshal Kim Jong Un and trust in him.
					
					  Songs "We Will Go to Mt. Paektu", "Let's Not Abandon Revolutionary Faith Though One May Die" and "Everlasting Echo" reverberate as marches for the final victory.
					
					 Popular among the service personnel and people are such songs as "Three Years-long War" and "Mother's Birthday".
					
					 The artistes of the State Merited Chorus staged the orchestra and male chorus "We'll Travel One Road Forever" as the marching song in Kim Jong Un's era on the occasion of the 70th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea in October.
					
					 Thousands of pieces of poems were created this year. They included the epics "Party's Flag, Mother's Care" and "Legendary Tale about Heroic Youth in Mt. Paektu".
					
					 The Korean April 26 Cartoon Film Studio produced serials of cartoon "The Boy General" and other cartoons while feature film "Rice Plant Flower" and TV series "Shield" were produced.
					
					 Art performances were staged in celebration of the WPK's birthday in October. The joint performance was staged by the State Merited Chorus and the Moranbong Band in the presence of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The art performance "Great Party, Shining Korea" staged by 10 000 artistes in celebration of the 70th birthday of the WPK was a great monumental masterpiece which reviewed the 70 years-long history of the great party and Juche-based art.
					
					 An art performance given by soldiers of companies of the Korean People's Army who proved successful at the 37th Art Festival of KPA Servicepersons, a grand young soldier-people chorus staged at the ceremony of marking the completion of the Paektusan Hero Youth Power Station and the April Spring People's Art Festival clearly showed the successes made in the popular art in the DPRK this year.

articles.title: Unha Taesong Foodstuff Factory
articles.content:
Unha Taesong Foodstuff Factory
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Unha Taesong Foodstuff Factory is one of well-known foodstuff factories for its high-quality products in the DPRK.
					 Its chief engineer Choe Mi Ok told KCNA that the factory was built under the loving care of supreme leader Kim Jong Un for people's wellbeing.
					
					 The factory, equipped with latest facilities, turns out over 300 kinds of products, including candies, processed meat and soft drinks, catfish sausage and smoked catfish, she said.
					
					 In particular, the soft drink made of Rosa davurica is getting popular among citizens as it is rich in vitamin, she added.
					
					 All the employees and officials of the factory are now working hard to greet the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea with increased production.
					
					 The factory, located in Pothonggang District, Pyongyang, went into operation in June last year.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Make Switchover in Its Policy
articles.content:
Successes Made in Field of Literature, Art in 2015
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is the root cause of turning the Korean Peninsula into the biggest hotspot in the world and a stumbling block lying in the way of ensuring peace and security, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article. 
					 The U.S. claims it stands for peace on the Korean Peninsula and has no hostile intent towards the DPRK, but its talking is no more than sophism to cover up its sinister intention, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. remains unchanged in its scenario to stifle the DPRK. The U.S. is harboring a daydream of hurting the DPRK at any cost, foolishly stressing the need to lead the DPRK to changes and bring down its social system. 
					
					 Big powers in the Asia-Pacific region are steadily expanding the sphere of their influence in the region, shaking the U.S. unchallenged position which has long remained strong. Much upset by this, the U.S. is working hard to keep its supremacy in the region at any cost. It is periodically escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula while dodging the issue of concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK in order to carry out its aggressive strategy for rebalancing in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 All the facts go to prove that it is impossible to solve the regional problems including the nuclear issue on the peninsula unless the U.S. gives up its sinister intention and rolls back its hostile policy toward the DPRK. 
					
					 The DPRK tells the U.S. it may wait for as long as it likes in pursuit of its anachronistic "strategic patience" policy. 
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the reality, discontinue its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK and reckless moves for aggression and boldly make a policy switchover.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses U.S. of Encouraging Japan in Its Bid to Emerge Military Giant
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses U.S. of Encouraging Japan in Its Bid to Emerge Military Giant
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Days ago, the U.S. administration decided to sell three "Global Hawks" to Japan.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday observes: This can hardly be considered as a common commercial deal. 
					
					 The U.S. is seeking an ulterior purpose in this deal.
					
					 It is in quest of its own interests that it is encouraging Japan in its moves to turn itself into a military giant, while allowing with pleasure the arms build-up of the Japanese reactionaries. Washington is keenly interested in the revival of militarism in Japan.
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. to put Japan under its tight control and use it as a shock force for carrying out its policy of Asian aggression.
					
					 It is the calculation of the U.S. that plugging Japan into the implementation of its strategy for rebalancing in Asia-Pacific would help implement without difficulty its policy of Asian aggression and make a fortune.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to behave itself, bearing deep in mind its act of encouraging Japan in its revival of militarism would ultimately bring disastrous consequences to itself.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Stage Demos in Solidarity with S. Koreans' Action
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Stage Demos in Solidarity with S. Koreans' Action
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. and other foreign countries on Dec. 5 expressed solidarity with the second large all-out people's action in south Korea, according to the south Korean online paper Voice of People.
					 Koreans in New York and Los Angeles staged solidarity demos against the repressive "regime" in south Korea.
					
					 They strongly rebuked the south Korean regime for cracking down on the righteous all-out people's action against the dictatorship.
					
					 They released a solidarity statement.
					
					 Overseas Koreans declared that they would stage demos in Chicago, Washington and other places of the U.S. and in Toronto, Canada and Sydney, Australia.

articles.title: Authorities' Suppression of People Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Suppression of People Denounced in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Voice of People Monday in an editorial condemned the south Korean conservative authorities for their moves to suppress the participants in the 2nd all-out people's action.
					More than 50,000 people from all walks of life took part in the 2nd all-out people's action despite the present regime's toughest threat, the editorial said, adding:
					
					The two all-out people's actions confirmed that the "government" is not only accepting people's demand but also refusing to have any dialogue.
					
					They also indicated that the "president" regards the people as enemy.
					
					It can hardly meet the demands of people through threat and suppression. Crackdown would only trigger off stronger resistance.
					
					It is inevitable to cause stronger action such as general strike.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hell-Bent on Their Unprecedented Suppression of People
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hell-Bent on Their Unprecedented Suppression of People
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities are getting hell-bent on their unprecedented suppression under the pretext of security in the wake of the November 14 all-out people's action, according to the south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Dec. 6.
					 The fascist police agency is creating terror-ridden atmosphere, claiming that it has obtained the evidence proving the fact that the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions prepared "illegal violent demonstration" and ordered some organizations to break through the police cordon made of buses and make a charge towards Chongwadae.
					
					 The agency announced that it is going through legal procedures for 585 participants who have been identified and have confirmed the correct identities of 946 others.
					
					 It also set up investigation headquarters at 16 local police agencies and mobilized thousands of police forces under the pretext of probing the "truth about extremely violent demonstration" and detecting "backstage forces."

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Censures Regime's Suppression of 2nd All-out People's Action
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Censures Regime's Suppression of 2nd All-out People's Action
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Kyunghyang Daily News in an editorial on Dec. 6 said that the 2nd all-out people's action staged on Dec. 5 showed the ruling forces' foolish attempt to suppress the freedom of assembly and demonstration by abusing power.
					 The editorial noted:
					
					 The action clearly showed who are posing a threat to democracy.
					
					 The chief-executive and the ruling party should not crack down upon the freedom of assembly and demonstration but pay heed to the anger of the people at the unilateral administration of state affairs.
					
					 The people clearly voiced objection to the retrogressive revision of the labor law and the introduction of the "state-compiled" history textbook through the two all-out people's actions.
					
					 The regime should bear in mind that the people's resentment has already run so high that it can hardly calm down it through crackdown under the pretext of security.

articles.title: Second All-out People's Action Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Second All-out People's Action Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The second all-out people's action was staged in Seoul on December 5 in protest against the south Korean conservative ruling forces' fascist suppression, retrogressive revision of the labor law and moves to "introduce state-compiled history textbook".
					 Participating in it were representatives of the Joint Council of Civic and Public Organizations composed of 500 organizations, workers, peasants, youth and students, religionists, figures of the opposition parties, more than 50,000 in all. 
					
					 The rally begun with the introduction of the video message sent by Han Sang Gyun, chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), who took refuge in Jogye Temple due to the police's threat to arrest him.
					
					 In the message the chairman of the KCTU said that the "government" disallowed the second all-out people's action, though he had already clarified his stand to stage it in the form of peaceful people's grand march. 
					
					 Then a declaration was made public.
					
					 It called for staging people's actions including third all-out people's action in all areas all at once on December 19, keeping pace with the general strike of the KCTU against the retrogressive revision of labor law, and turning out in the movement to have progressive politics for people centered on workers, peasants and the poor enforced.
					
					 The rally conveyed news of the actions staged by Koreans overseas in solidarity with the second all-out people's action, and that international labor organizations sent messages of protest demanding a stop to the operation to arrest the KCTU chief, the release of those arrested and halt to the retrogressive revision of the labor law to Chongwadae and south Korean embassies in various countries. 
					
					 Speakers warned the "government" and the chief executive who turned deaf ears to the voices of the people would face history's judgment.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed by Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation on December 4.
					 Alexandr Gromov, first secretary of the Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events including a remembrance meeting, seminar and film show on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian, Ugandan Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian, Ugandan Personages
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the exploits of leader Kim Jong Il was held by the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association in Russia and a remembrance meeting by the Makerere University in Uganda on Dec. 1 and 3 respectively on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					 Viktor Yegorov, chairman of the Russian association, said in a speech that the whole life of Kim Jong Il was a noble life of a peerless patriot totally dedicated to the country and nation.
					
					 The chairman praised him as a great leader who unrolled a great plan for building a thriving nation and laid an eternal foundation for the prosperity of the DPRK.
					
					 V.S. Posnov, vice- chairman of the Russian association, noted that the DPRK has achieved one victory after another under the leadership of Kim Jong Il despite the ceaseless moves of the imperialists to stifle it. 
					
					 Henri Masico, department director of the Presidency of Uganda, the chairman of the Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism at Makerere University in Uganda and other participants noted Kim Jong Il protected the sovereignty and dignity of the country from the imperialists' moves to bring down socialism and stifle the DPRK and turned it into the world's political and military power.
					
					 They praised him as the world's elder statesman as he wisely led the global cause of independence and rendered material and moral support to the African people in the building of a new society.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered by South African Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered by South African Organization
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The South African Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted a special article on Dec. 1 on the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 An article titled "On the 4th anniversary of demise of HE Kim Jong Il" said it is 4 years since Kim Jong Il passed away but his exploits have always been glorified by the Korean people.
					
					 The article went on:
					
					 The Korean people made sure that he lies in state at the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun and erected with due respect his statues and mosaics depicting his beaming image in different parts of the country.
					
					 They are holding him in high esteem as the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and literary works in praise of his noble revolutionary career and exploits have been produced.
					
					 All these are a manifestation of the noble moral obligation and loyalty to Kim Jong Il who developed the Juche idea and Songun idea in depth into a guiding idea of the era of independence and successfully applied them into practice, turning the DPRK into an invincible political, ideological and military power, a satellite manufacturer and launcher and a nuclear weapons state and making distinguished contributions to the human cause of independence.
					
					 The Korean people have stepped up the dynamic advance to implement the behests of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is leading this dynamic advance.
					
					 Rosy is the future of socialist Korea as it is led by Kim Jong Un victoriously leading the people despite the U.S. and its allied forces' ceaseless challenges.

articles.title: Coro Estatal Benemerito y Banda Moranbong realizaran la visita de amistad a China
articles.content:
Coro Estatal Benemerito y Banda Moranbong realizaran la visita de amistad a China
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Coro Estatal Benemerito y la Banda Moranbong, de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, realizaran del dia 10 al 15 una visita de amistad a la Republica Popular China para ofrecer la funcion.
					La visita de amistad de dichas entidades artisticas contribuira a profundizar el sentimiento de amistad y desarrollar mas el intercambio cultural y artistico entre los pueblos de ambos paises.

articles.title: Obreros de RPDC responden a llamamiento de Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae
articles.content:
Obreros de RPDC responden a llamamiento de Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar en las fabricas y empresas del pais los actos de juramento de empleados para responder al llamamiento emitido a los obreros del pais por los del Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae con motivo del VII Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					 En las ocasiones se dio lectura al llamamiento y hubo informe e intervenciones.
					
					 En el acto del Complejo Siderurgico Kim Chaek los oradores subrayaron que los obreros de la rama de industria metalurgica deben acelerar la modernizacion y la informatizacion al estilo coreano tomando como vida la ciencia y tecnica con la noble mision de explorador de la construccion de un Estado prospero y desarrollar con dinamismo una campana para utilizar los materiales y equipos domesticos.
					
					  En el Complejo Quimico Juventud de Hamhung y el Complejo de Fertilizantes de Hungnam destacaron la necesidad de establecer cabalmente el sistema de produccion independiente basado en los materiales y los recursos de Corea y producir y asegurar suficientemente las materias y los abonos necesarios a las ramas de industria ligera y agricultura contribuyendo asi a la mejora de vida del pueblo.
					
					  Tambien los empleados del Complejo de Maquinas de Minas de Carbon de Ranam expresaron su juramento de responder con ingentes exitos productivos al llamamiento.
					
					  Los empleados del Combinado de Alimentos de Jongbangsan senalaron que la gran ambicion y objetivo de la clase obrera de Corea es crear en el mas alto nivel lo mejor mirando hacia el mundo y tomaron la decision de producir muchos alimentos sabrosos y nutritivos con sus propias fuerzas y tecnicas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun exige a EE.UU. cambiar su política sobre RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun exige a EE.UU. cambiar su política sobre RPDC
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La política hostil de Estados Unidos contra la República Popular Democrática de Corea convirtió la Península Coreana en la zona más candente del mundo y obstaculiza el aseguramiento de la paz y la seguridad. 
					Adelanta el diario Rodong Sinmun en un artículo individual de este martes y continúa:
					
					EE.UU. suele decir que desea la paz de la Península Coreana y no tiene la hostilidad a la RPDC, pero esto es una palabrería para ocultar su designio malintencionado. 
					
					Es invariable el intento de EE.UU. de aplastar a la RPDC. 
					
					El imperio sólo sueña con dañarla abogando por inducirla por el cambio y arruinamiento del régimen. 
					
					Muy aturdido por la sacudión de su posición hegemónica en la región de Asia-Pacífico por el aumento de la zona de influencia de las potencias regionales, el imperio se desespera por mantener a toda costa su dominio. Para realizar la estrategia de reequilibro de carácter agresivo en la región de Asia-Pacífico, agrava periódicamente la situación de la Península Coreana negando la firma del convenio de paz con la RPDC. 
					
					El hecho evidencia que no se resolverán el problema nuclear de la Península Coreana y otros asuntos regionales mientras que EE.UU. no abandone su maligna intención ni retire la política de hostilidad a la RPDC. 
					
					Es infructuosa la política de "paciencia estratégica" de EE.UU. 
					
					EE.UU. debe cambiar con audacia su política sobre la RPDC sin recurrir a la anacrónica política hostil anti-RPDC y a las imprudentes maniobras de agresión.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela objetivo fundamental de negocio de armamentos entre EE.UU. y Japón
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela objetivo fundamental de negocio de armamentos entre EE.UU. y Japón
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, la Administración estadounidense decidió vender a Japón tres drones de espía "Global Hawk".
					Esta decisión no se puede ser considerada como un simple negocio comercial.
					
					Así señala el periódico Minju Joson en un comentario individual del día 8 y continúa: 
					
					A partir de sus intereses, EE.UU. aplaude las maniobras de Japón por convertirse en la potencia militar apoyando al aumento armamentista de los reaccionarios japonenses. Ahora, el imperio norteamericano tiene interés imprescindible en la resucitación de militarismo en Japón.
					
					EE.UU. quiere tomar en su mano el Japón para usarlo como brigada de choque en la realización de su política de agresión a Asia. EE.UU. calcula que si introduce a Japón en sus maniobras para materializar la estrategia de reequilibrio en Asia y el Pacífico, podrá practicar sin dificultades la agresiva política sobre Asia y ganar el dinero.
					
					EE.UU. debe actuar con prudencia teniendo presente de que sus actos criminales antipacíficos arriba mencionados le traerán al fin y al cabo el trágico resultado.
